definition[0]: to offer to have sex with someone in exchange for money
definition[1]: to ask someone for money, help, or information
example[1]: Morgan is accused of illegally soliciting campaign contributions.
example[2]: The governor sent two officials to Mexico City to solicit aid from the president.
definition[2]: to try to sell a product or service by taking it to homes or businesses and showing it to the people there
example[3]: No soliciting on company premises is allowed.
definition[3]: to ask someone for information or help
example[4]: She called meetings to solicit the views of her staff.
example[5]: He admitted that he solicited $34 million from 1,000 investors.
definition[5]: to sell something by taking orders for a product or service, usually by going to peopleâ€™s houses or businesses
example[6]: The office products supplier regularly solicits business in North Dakota.
